snippet: A Yale professor came across a piece of petrified wood believed to have come from Southbury, Conn., leading to the discovery of a new genus (or family) and species of conifer: a tree, now extinct, that grew 200 million years ago.
abstract: Connecticut's Petrified Forest exhibition, at Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History in New Haven, features piece of petrified wood found by a Yale professor on a 22-acre farm in Southbury; find led to discovery of a new genus and species of conifer, now extinct, that grew 200 million years ago (Metropolitan/Connecticut).
lead_paragraph: A Yale professor came across a piece of petrified wood believed to have come from Southbury, Conn., leading to the discovery of a new genus (or family) and species of conifer: a tree, now extinct, that grew 200 million years ago.

headline.main: From the Age of Dinosaurs, Hard Clues
headline.print_headline: From the Age of Dinosaurs, Hard Clues
